headline: Pound slumps to lowest level in four months
summary: The pound has dropped to its lowest level in over four months amid mounting concerns over the state of the UK economy.

headline: GM Cuts 1,000 Jobs in Latest Belt-Tightening Effort
summary: General Motors has cut 1,000 jobs, according to a person familiar with the reductions, marking the latest effort by the automaker to trim costs as it ramps up sales in unprofitable electric vehicles.

raw.headline: GM Cuts 1,000 Jobs in Latest Belt-Tightening Effort
raw.summary: General Motors has cut 1,000 jobs, according to a person familiar with the reductions, marking the latest effort by the automaker to trim costs as it ramps up sales in unprofitable electric vehicles.

headline: General Motors to lay off 1000 workers
summary: General Motors (GM) has announced plans for another round of workforce reductions. According to the company's statement issued to AP, GM intends to lay off approximately 1,000 employees as part of an effort to "optimize for speed and excellence" across its operations. The workers impacted by the cuts are mostly white-collar employees. Morning Brief anchors Seana Smith and Brad Smith dive into the details of the automaker's latest cost-cutting initiative. To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Morning Brief here. This post was written by Angel Smith

headline: General Motors lays off about 1,000 workers, cutting costs to compete in a crowded automobile market
summary: General Motors is laying off about 1,000 workers worldwide, shedding costs as it tries to compete in a crowded global automobile market.  The workers, mostly white collar, were notified about the decisions early Friday.  "This includes operating with efficiency, ensuring we have the right team structure and focusing on our top priorities."

raw.headline: General Motors lays off about 1,000 workers, cutting costs to compete in a crowded automobile market

"This includes operating with efficiency, ensuring we have the right team structure and focusing on our top priorities."

headline: GM laying off nearly 1,000 workers, most in US, source says
summary: (Reuters) -General Motors is laying off nearly 1,000 workers worldwide, most in the U.S., as it looks to streamline operations, a source told Reuters on Friday.  GM confirmed in a statement it had made job cuts.  "In order to win in this competitive market, we need to optimize for speed and excellence," the Detroit automaker said.

headline: Wall Street Breakfast Podcast: Ford Hit With $165M Fine For Recall Delay
summary: NHTSA slaps Ford with $165M fine for failing to timely issue recall. GM's Cruise to pay $500,000 fine for false report on car crash. Hims & Hers cut to underperform over Amazon competition.
